result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya M Tracy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Suspension of Drivers License for 18 months.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
AODA Assessment.

miscConds.notes:
Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharge.  
DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
Pay a $350.00 fine.   Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Complete a parenting class.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tonya M Tracy in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
BAil refund check packet.

ADDRESS INFO for Tonya M Tracy
Current: 426 S 74th St, Milwaukee, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 11-06-2015)
Prior: 1201 W. College Ave.  Apt.# 133, Oak Creek, WI 53154
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Tonya M Tracy in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Tonya M Tracy in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 2/26/16.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharge.  
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  
-Pay a $350.00 fine.   Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED
-Suspension of Drivers License for 18 months.
-AODA Assessment
.
AS TO COUNT 3:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 53 days time served. 
.
